lead_paragraph: As a post-coup-attempt purge by the government intensified, Turkish officials assured citizens that the state of emergency would not trample on personal freedoms.

byline.contributor: Ceylan Yeginsu contributed reporting from Istanbul, and Niki Kitsantonis from Athens.

headline.print_headline: Erdogan Sends a Text Across Turkey, Urging Continued ‘Heroic Resistance’
headline.main: Erdogan Sends a Text Across Turkey, Urging Loyalty

snippet: As a post-coup-attempt purge by the government intensified, Turkish officials assured citizens that the state of emergency would not trample on personal freedoms....
abstract: Turkey's Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan sends text to country's citizens calling for their continued presence in public squares in aftermath of failed coup; reiterates his belief coup was hatched by Pennsylvania-based cleric Fethullah Gulen; officials assert declaration of state of emergency will not curtail personal freedoms.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
